reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: African Swine Fever Workshop for First Responders

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award APHIS is supporting Purdue University in the development and delivery of a comprehensive training program for first responders and field investigators in Asia that will assist in the management and resolution of outbreaks of African swine fever (ASF) on premises that house swine. In addition to formulation of outbreak response plans, the progrma will cover ASF epidemiology, diagnostics, and biosecurity applications..

participating-org.usg:office-name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The United States is engaging Thailand primarily as a development partner to leverage its significant resources as an upper middle income country to encourage it to take a greater leadership role in addressing global and regional challenges of mutual concern. Throughout its modern history as a constitutional monarchy, Thailand has experienced years of political uncertainty, including, most recently, a military coup in May 2014 following six months of protests, the dissolution of parliament, and failed national elections. Such dramatic shifts in the political system are disruptive for a key U.S. ally and make clear that there is a continued need for engagement in priority areas with U.S. support for good governance and transnational rule of law. Many political, legal, and criminal justice institutions are still developing and will benefit from continued U.S. engagement. Achieving U.S. strategic goals in Thailand and in the region is predicated on the country's stability. U.S. assistance will promote peace and security, foster reforms and modernization of the criminal justice system, and strengthen good governance.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Salaries and Expenses, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Agriculture
